content:
You are a reader assistant. You simplify a passage from a scientific paper to make it more readable by performing an iterative algorithm that focuses on atomic changes.

You are also given two parameters: DC (Desired Complexity) – a desired complexity of the simplified text, and ILT (Information Loss Tolerance) – a threshold for information loss compared to original passage that specifies whether an atomic change should be accepted or not.

The algorithm is as follows:
1. Determine if the text is at desired complexity (DC), if yes, terminate the algorithm, else continue.
2. Identify a section of the text whose complexity is above DC.
3. Propose a simplification of the identified section.
4. Identify information loss and the severity of it – if the severity for any of the information loss questions is higher than information loss tolerance (ILT), reject changes, else update the current state of the passage
5. Adjust the passage to maintain readability and flow of text, then run a new iteration of the algorithm.

When the algorithm terminates, you print the final simplified passage

When responding to prompts, only respond to the given question and do not proceed to the next step

Algorithm parameters are as follows.
DC: Average person
ILT: Medium-High

The original passage is provided in the following message

Derived from the classic image classification algorithms, our classifier has been constructed in the form of a fast 39-layered Inception model, that evaluates the presence of roads using the tomographic reconstructions of the input frames.
The latest version of the simplified passage is provided in the following prompt

Derived from the classic image classification algorithms, our classifier has been constructed in the form of a fast 39-layered Inception model, that evaluates the presence of roads using the tomographic reconstructions of the input frames.
Identify which parts of the simplified passage are the most complex, then the complexity level of the passage. Limit your answer to a maximum of 5 sentences

The most complex parts of the simplified passage are the phrases "39-layered Inception model" and "tomographic reconstructions of the input frames". These phrases are complex because they contain technical jargon and abstract concepts that may require prior knowledge to understand. The complexity level of the passage is approximately 7 out of 10, with 1 being very simple and 10 being very complex. The passage is at an intermediate level, requiring some basic knowledge of computer science and technology.
FKGL score of the latest passage version is 19.48. Is determined complexity higher than DC (Average person)?  Answer "Yes" or "No"
Yes
Identify a single complicated section of the simplified passage. Remember to respect the ILT (Medium-High) contraint. Only provide the identified section

Simplify this section. Only provide the proposed simplification
Multi-layered Inception model
Reincorporate the simplified section into the simplified passage

Derived from the classic image classification algorithms, our classifier has been constructed in the form of a multi-layered Inception model, that evaluates the presence of roads using the tomographic reconstructions of the input frames.

Identify information loss and its severity in the updated simplified passage compared to the original passage. Comparison must be between the originally provided (the very first) passage and the current simplified version with the proposed change. Limit your answer to a maximum of 5 sentences

The proposed simplification resulted in a loss of information about the specific number of layers in the Inception model (39). The severity of this information loss is considered medium, as it changes the specificity of the model architecture. The change does not significantly alter the overall understanding of the model, but it reduces the precision. The overall impact of this change is acceptable, given the ILT (Medium-High) constraint.
What is the highest severity level identified in your last answer? Is it higher than ILT (Medium-High)? Provide the highest severity level, followed by an answer to the ILT question as "Yes" or "No"

Medium
No
Accept the proposed simplification. Print the updated version of the simplified passage, do not print anything else
